meanings.definition: Petrifiers: substances that turn organic material into stone.
meanings.sent1: The petrifiers in the cave slowly transformed the wood into stone.
meanings.sent2: The ancient petrifiers were used to create beautiful sculptures from trees.
meanings.sent3: The petrifiers in the garden had a magical effect, turning flowers into stone statues.
meanings.sent4: The petrifiers worked their magic on the fallen leaves, creating a stone pathway.
meanings.sent5: The petrifiers in the laboratory were used to study the process of turning wood into stone.

meanings.definition: Petrifiers: people or things that cause fear or paralysis.
meanings.sent1: The dark figure in the corner seemed like a petrifier, freezing me in fear.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house was full of petrifiers lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent3: The petrifiers at the Halloween party were just friends in scary costumes.
meanings.sent4: The petrifiers in the horror movie made the audience jump out of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The petrifiers in the storybook were more exciting than frightening, making the children giggle.

meanings.definition: Petrifiers: processes that turn something into stone.
meanings.sent1: The slow petrifiers of time gradually transformed the ancient ruins into stone.
meanings.sent2: The petrifiers of nature sculpted the cliffs into majestic rock formations.
meanings.sent3: The petrifiers of the art class turned clay into beautiful stone-like sculptures.
meanings.sent4: The petrifiers of history preserved the ancient artifacts in solid stone form.
meanings.sent5: The petrifiers of legend were said to have the power to turn anything they touched into stone.
